cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi (115 km) SSE of Port Aransas, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing generally northward, then turning north-northeast, with the center forecast to move onshore along the central Texas coast tonight and track inland across southeast Texas toward southwest Louisiana through Tuesday–Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port O’Connor and San Luis Pass, very near Freeport, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning, Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas, TX to San Luis Pass, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande, TX to Sabine Pass, TX (TS); Port Aransas, TX to Sabine Pass, TX including Matagorda & Galveston Bays (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast including Matagorda Peninsula, Freeport/Lake Jackson area, Galveston Bay, and adjacent bays
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with higher gusts possible; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if Nicholas reaches hurricane strength near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground level possible along the coast near and just northeast of Freeport (Matagorda Bay to San Luis Pass).
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with locally up to 20 inches possible; significant flash and urban flooding likely in the Freeport/Lake Jackson area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Flash flooding, dangerous surf/rip currents, isolated tornadoes embedded in outer rainbands.
